intro: Allium costatovaginatum, commonly known as the variable garlic. It is a flowering plant in the Amaryllidaceae family, characterized by its bulbous structure and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale purple flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. It is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
